instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.PPVOUT_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_LCDBKLT is the backlight power rail that is responsible for creating a backlight o nthe screen. .

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Heavy liquid damage, melted LVDS connector on T-conn board. No Backlight
threads.message:
Replaced LVDS cable to the board, and tested with spare LCD, I can see faint light but no backlight. Heavy oxidation around UP800, QP801; CP951/2/3/7
Melted LP610, replaced. 

Voltages with connected LCD:

<SIGNAL>PPV5_CAM</SIGNAL> - 5.17V
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBCKLT</SIGNAL> - 0V
FP800 intact, as expected - 12V
<SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_FET_DRV</SIGNAL> - 0V

Before I replace UP800, anything else to check?
No shorts in the area.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Heavy liquid damage, melted LVDS connector on T-conn board. No Backlight
threads.message: Check all resistors and traces in the backlight area.

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Heavy liquid damage, melted LVDS connector on T-conn board. No Backlight
threads.message: If I get 53V at <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>, the boosting of it should be working right?

threads.title: SOLVED: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Heavy liquid damage, melted LVDS connector on T-conn board. No Backlight
threads.message:
53V is high too much.
There is no connection with LEDs strip.
